marklogic.body: I can see a lot of issues hurting Republicans over the next year, but not this one. A majority of Americans have never supported Obamacare. The tragedy is that Obama, Pelosi, Reid, et al. could have built consensus, but they went for the jugular when the general public wasn't willing yet to offer up it's neck. On this particular issue, hubris in the sense of a traditional Greek tragedy might lead to President Obama's electoral downfall. Acerbic as it sounds, Scalia's comment about mandating the consumption of broccoli is a good soundbite and perhaps on point also. Meanwhile, the common worker who is neither a Republican member of the country club nor a liberal Ivy League grad will suffer. Cough, hack, sure wish I had health care but I'm Glad President Obama was able to assure Russia that he can offer it flexibility on shields to nuclear attack if voters will just reelect him. And yes, these opinion may seem a mix of liberal and conservative but you are hearing a personal genuine reaction to events over the last week. Pollsters take note.
